response.answer_text: time is relative parameter,  it is rate of change of state of matter and energy if there is no matter than also relative time exist for energy. assuming there was only energy which was not imparted to matter yet. Einstein's e=mc2 only stands for the relation between energy and matter here also energy is inversely proportional to time. at t=0,  E= infinity but infinity energy is not practical, otherwise no creation start. So time has some value of 0.000.......0000.....0x.  E= mc^2 is not the definition of energy. It's just rest energy, not anything else. More appropriately, in the case of a "free particle" (one that has no forces acting on it), the relativistic equation for energy becomes E^2 = (mc^2)^2 + (pc)^2, where c is the speed of light and p is the particle's momentum. If you let m=0, then this reduces to E = pc. Quantum Mechanics shows that photons have energy related to their frequency. It has 0 mass, but still has energy; therefore, it has momentum E/c. The key point is that the formula E=mc^2 is referring only to rest energy, not all the energy of something. 0 mass means 0 rest energy, but there are other energies than rest energy. Also, keep in mind that E=mc^2 shows that there's an equivalence of mass and energy. You can convert mass to energy (as in a nuclear reaction) or you can turn energy into mass (as in pair production). This leads to the idea that while not exactly the same, energy and mass are different forms of the same fundamental "being." The photonic particles (light) becomes trapped. This combination of photons wrapped up in collapsed sheets of spacetime is what we call matter. E=MC^2 is more of a chemical reaction than a physical law.

No! Neither Time nor Space can exist without the Matter, aka the Universe made up of physical stuff. First, without the Matter there wouldn't be anything capable to determine the existence of Time or Space. Secondly, Time can only be measured using Matter, namely, interactions between material objects. So, if there is no Matter, the concept of Time would cease to exist instantly.

Time is frequency of change. When subsequent state of change is different from previous state then only we can perceive change, hence we perceive time. But no perception does not necessarily mean that time does not exist. When you sleep you cannot perceive but time ticks. You come to know about it only when you are awaken after sleep.
